div.p: Dr. Rustin Clark grew up on a farm just south of Mayfield, and, after graduating from Wellington High School in 1986, attended Friends University, earning a Bachelor of Science degree. While teaching middle and high school math for the next few years, he attended Wichita State University and earned a Master’s degree in education administration. In 1995 he became K-12 principal in Haviland. After two years in that position, he was hired by Chase-Raymond for his first Superintendent of Schools position before becoming superintendent in Moundridge where he also finished his Doctorate from Kansas State University. After . . .

h3.a: Kansas Board of Regents 2020 Kansas State Scholar

div.p: Hope Casner has worked hard to become designated as a 2020 KANSAS STATE SCHOLAR by the Kansas Board of Regents on behalf of the Kansas Legislature. She is among the 2,641 high school students selected from 6,262 Kansas high school seniors who completed the Kansas Scholars Curriculum this year. In order to achieve the honor, Casner had to take more classes above and beyond the normal high school requirements for graduation and have an ACT of 30 or above. Casner has to take two years of a foreign language, one year of physics, and four years of math which is one more year than required to . . .

div.p:
Argonia Parent Education Guide
Spring Semester 2020: 4th 9 weeks
Curriculum and assignments being sent from the teachers are the minimum standards your student(s) need to complete to finish out this unusual end of the school year. This work is required for students to receive credit for the fourth nine weeks. If student(s) do not complete and return the assignments, they will not receive credit. The semester grade will be averaged between the third 9 weeks and the fourth 9 weeks grades.
Students will be issued a free Kansas library card to check out online books or audiobooks through the . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Argonia Continuous Learning Plan Guidance

h3.a: New Argonia Jr/Sr High School Principal 20-21

div.p:
Argonia USD 359 is pleased to announce the new principal of Argonia Jr/Sr High School. Luke Greenwood will be taking over the principal duties in August, 2020. Mr. Greenwood will be completing his building licensure program through Ft. Hays State University and will be working under the direction of Argonia’s new Superintendent of Schools. The Argonia School Board is currently conducting a superintendent search and expects to have the position filled by the end of April.
The Argonia School Board Members feel that having Mr. Greenwood serve as an . . .
